title: Boolean Logic
description: Boolean logic in BPL uses the standard operators: AND (&&), OR (||), and NOT (!). BPL implements short-circuit evaluation - in 'a && b', b is only evaluated if a is true; in 'a || b', b is only evaluated if a is false. This optimization prevents unnecessary computation and enables safe patterns like 'ptr != null && *ptr > 0'. Comparison operators (==, !=, <, >, <=, >=) produce boolean values. Non-boolean values can be used in boolean contexts: 0 is false, non-zero is true; null is false, non-null is true. This example demonstrates logical operators, short-circuiting, and boolean expressions.
